feed.title: NewsTracker: google
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Dell to sell Google Chromebook tailored for corporate users
entry.summary: The new machine from Dell joins Google's line-up of other high-end, business-focused devices that include the Asus Chromebook Flip and Chromebook Pixel.

entry.title: Dell to sell Google Chromebook tailored for corporate users
entry.summary:
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) - Google's latest Chromebook laptop will be specially designed for corporate customers in an effort to get more workers off machines powered by Microsoft's dominant Windows software.

17. Prices will range from $400 to $900, a step up from a line of bare-bones Chromebooks that have been selling for as low as $150 since Google teamed up with Hisense and Haier to make those devices.

Google Inc. is trying to win over corporate customers with the Dell Chromebook 13, which offers more flexibility to run a variety of apps that haven't been easily accessible on previous Chromebooks.

Various PC manufacturers that building Windows machines for decades have been working with Google to design lightweight laptops running on the Chrome operating system since 2011.

entry.title: Google has until Aug. 31 to reply to EU antitrust charges
entry.summary: Google Inc has been given an extra two weeks to respond to European Union charges of abusing its market power in a dozen EU countries and stave off a possible billion-euro fine.

entry.title: Google has until August 31 to reply to EU antitrust charges
entry.summary: A woman hovers a mouse over the Google and European Union logos in Sarajevo, in this April 15, 2015 photo illustration.

entry.title: Google has until August 31 to reply to EU antitrust charges
entry.summary:
The European Commission has extended the deadline for replying to the charges until Aug. 31, a Google spokesman said on Thursday.

European Competition Commissioner Margrethe Vestager's charges in April escalated a five-year investigation which Google previously tried to settle three times, without success.

entry.title: Kristen Stewart addresses her sexuality: ?Google me, I?m not hiding?
entry.summary: But when asked by Nylon Magazine if she was out, her answer was more ambiguous: "Google me, I'm not hiding".

entry.title: Google creating new parent company Alphabet
entry.summary:
Investors cheered the corporate restructuring announced Monday for giving greater visibility into Google's central business and seemed less anxious about zany ventures that may pose as distractions.

Nest, anti-aging company Calico, smart cities company Sidewalk, secretive lab Google X, as well as Google Capital and Google Ventures - two investing units - will all be run separately with their own leaders, Google said.

entry.title: Google creating new parent company Alphabet
entry.summary:
They added that Google's self-driving cars and health ventures, such as storing data on human DNA in the cloud, are potentially profitable, but not for at least several years.

"Heck, Google itself lost money for years before it went public," he said.

entry.title: Judge upholds warrant requiring Google to share contents of indicted Rand Paul aide's Gmail
entry.summary: Magistrate Judge Helen Adams rejected a request Monday by Jesse Benton to quash a warrant ordering Google Inc. to turn over the contents of his Gmail account.

entry.title: The ABCs of Google's new name Alphabet
entry.summary:
Most corporate naming experts say Google's decision to reorganize its businesses under a new holding company called "Alphabet" is close to letter perfect.

Because it is part of Google's corporate structure, Alphabet is not likely to become part of the lexicon like "Googling" did; it will mainly be used on Wall Street.

Most naming experts agree that Google struck the right balance with Alphabet.

entry.title: Google overhaul 'shareholder friendly' but details scarce
entry.summary:
Google Inc's overhaul of its operating structure is an acknowledgement of the lack of transparency surrounding its disparate businesses and projects, analysts said, but it remains to be seen how much more the company will actually disclose.

Analysts and investors have long sought more granular detail on Google's capital spending and cash flow, as well as the financial performance of YouTube and Android.

entry.title: Google overhaul 'shareholder friendly' but details scarce
entry.summary: Still, Google did not say what details it would disclose.

entry.title: Bits Blog: Google Remakes Itself as Alphabet
entry.summary: In a blog post, Mr. Page said they picked the name Alphabet because it "means a collection of letters that represent language, one of humanity's most important innovations, and is the core of how we index with Google search!"

entry.title: Google creates new company Alphabet, names new CEO
entry.summary:
"Our company is operating well today, but we think we can make it cleaner and more accountable," Google co-founder Larry Page said.

"This new structure will allow us to keep tremendous focus on the extraordinary opportunities we have inside of Google," Page said.

Google, Samsung to issue monthly Android fixes
entry.summary:
Previously, Google would develop a patch and distribute it to its own Nexus phones after the discovery of security flaws.

Google made its roughly weekly security scans of Russian phones more frequent and was able to reduce the problems to close to the global norm.

He added that only about one in 200 Android phones Google can peer into have any potentially harmful applications installed at any point.

entry.title: Fin24.com | Google, Samsung to issue monthly Android security fixes

entry.title: Google's ultra-fast Internet service expands to San Antonio
entry.summary:
SAN ANTONIO (AP) - Google's ultra-fast Internet service is coming to San Antonio, the largest city yet to be promised the opportunity to accelerate the speed of their online access.

With the addition of San Antonio announced Wednesday, a total of 24 U.S. cities scattered through seven states have now been selected as markets for an Internet service called "Google Fiber."

Google Inc. is installing fiber-optic lines in selected cities to deliver Internet service at one gigabit per second, up to 100 times faster than existing services.

entry.title: Google Fiber's Next City Is Its Biggest Yet: San Antonio, Texas
Google loses bid to overturn low-cost patent licenses to Microsoft
entry.summary:
Both Microsoft and Google declined to comment on the decision.

The case has been broadly followed by the technology industry because it could affect how Google and others negotiate royalty rates on their technology.

Google appealed the verdict and the royalty rate to the 9th Circuit.

Google getting whipped into shape by Wall Street veteran Ruth Porat
entry.summary:
Not only was she a chief financial officer and former head of Morgan Stanley's financial institutions group, but she had worked on many technology deals as a mergers and acquisitions specialist, including Google's initial public stock offering.

Pitz worked with Porat during the eight years he was a research analyst at Morgan Stanley, including the time when Google went public.

entry.title: Google rides in: See Mongolia from the back of a horse-drawn sled
entry.summary:
"Google hopes that bringing Street View to Mongolia will raise awareness of the country as an emerging destination for visitors around the world, and support the country's economic growth moving forward," said Google's Susan Pointer.

Photo: A Google Street View member walks with a specialized camera to record the surroundings of the Choijin Lama Museum in the Mongolian capital of Ulan Bator.

entry.title: Review: Google photo service is strong on search
entry.summary:
This product image provided by Google shows the search feature of the Google Photos mobile app.

The latest offering, Google Photos, isn't perfect.

Google and Apple use face-recognition technology to sort photos by individuals, while Yahoo knows only that there's someone there - not who.

entry.title: Review: Google photo service is strong on search
entry.summary:
NEW YORK (AP) - Google's new service for organizing and backing up images blends some of the best of what Apple and Yahoo have rolled out in recent months.

Photo services from Google, Yahoo and Apple all store copies of those photos and video online.

On the other hand, Google has the best tools for searching photos.

Here's a look at Google Photos and how it compares with Apple's and Yahoo's offerings.

Photos and video on your device will automatically upload to Google's servers.

Google, Apple and Yahoo use computer software to tag photos to help you find them more easily.

Google shareholders revel in record 1-day windfall of $65.1B
entry.summary: Google's market capitalization, already around $403 billion, rose some $65 billion to finish at $468.3 billion, according to S&P Dow Jones Indices.

entry.title: Google shares gain a record $65 billion
entry.summary: Google's stock roared out of a long slumber Friday to produce the biggest shareholder windfall in U.S. history as investors rewarded the Internet company for promising to curb its spending on risky projects.

entry.title: Google shareholders revel in record 1-day windfall of $65.1B
entry.summary:
A 16 percent surge in Google's publicly traded stock translated into an additional $65.1 billion in shareholder wealth, on paper at least.

Google's gigantic run-up came after the Mountain View, California, company reported quarterly earnings that topped analyst estimates for the first time since late 2013.

The company's inability to hit the targets that steer investors had raised doubts about Google that had caused its stock to lag the rest of the market since the end of 2013.

Although Google has still been making plenty of money, many investors believed the company needed to clamp down on expenses.

entry.title: Google shareholders revel in record 1-day windfall of $65.1B

entry.title: Google shares gain a record $65B in value
entry.summary: Google's Class C shares rose 16.1 percent to $672.93.

entry.title: Google propels Nasdaq to another record high close

entry.title: After 2nd-quarter results, Google looks set to gain a record $50B in market value Friday
entry.summary:
NEW YORK - Google is already one of the largest companies in the world, and on Friday it's making one of the largest stock market moves ever.

That pushed Google's Class A stock above $700 for the first time.

Including the gains in Google Inc.'s Class A and nonvoting Class C shares, that puts the company on pace for the biggest single-day market cap gain ever.

entry.title: Etsy shares spike after Google mention
entry.summary:
Shares of e-commerce website Etsy jumped as much as 30 percent on Friday thanks to a nod from Google during its quarterly conference call.

"It started with (the) Google commentary last night," Wedbush analyst Gil Luria said, adding that short sellers closing their bets were driving the stock up further.

entry.title: Google shares soar as YouTube growth allays fears over Facebook
entry.summary: The surge in the stock, which sent the Nasdaq composite index to a record intraday high, came a day after Google reported better-than-expected revenue and profit for the first time in six quarters.

Google rose $87, or 14.6 percent, to $690.

entry.title: Google self-driving car involved in first injury accident
entry.summary: FILE - In this May 13, 2015, file photo, Google's self-driving Lexus car drives along street during a demonstration at Google campus in Mountain View, Calif.

entry.title: Google self-driving car involved in first injury accident
entry.summary: Google has invested heavily as a pioneer of self-driving cars, technology it believes will be safer and more efficient than human drivers.

entry.title: Google self-driving car involved in first injury accident
entry.summary:
Google revealed Thursday that one of its self-driving car prototypes was involved in an injury accident for the first time.

In the collision, a Lexus SUV that the tech giant outfitted with sensors and cameras was rear-ended in Google's home city of Mountain View, where more than 20 prototypes have been self-maneuvering through traffic.

Google's SUV was going about 15 mph in self-driving mode behind two other cars as the group approached an intersection with a green light.

The Google car and the other car in front of it also stopped.

Google has said that its car has not caused any of the collisions -- though in 2011 an employee who took a car to run an errand rear-ended another vehicle while the Google car was out of self-driving mode.

entry.title: Google self-driving car involved in first injury accident
entry.summary:
In 11 of the 14, Google said its car was rear-ended.

Within about a second, a fourth vehicle rear-ended the Google car at about 17 mph.

entry.title: Google self-driving car involved in first injury accident

entry.summary: Google Inc. on Thursday, July 15, 2015 reported second-quarter earnings of $3.41 billion.

entry.title: Google's 2Q signals new era of austerity with new CFO
entry.summary: Google could have been making more money all along if the growth in its expenses hadn't consistently been rising faster than its revenue, Gillis said.

entry.title: Google profit trumps estimates on ad revenue growth
Google posts 2nd-quarter results, may clamp down on spending
entry.summary: Google's operating expenses climbed 13 per cent from last year in the second quarter, slightly eclipsing an 11 per cent increase in the company's revenue to $17.7 billion US.

entry.title: Google's 2Q signals new era of austerity with new CFO
entry.summary:
Investors were delighted with the breakthrough and Porat's encouraging remarks about reining in Google's expenses.

Expenses now seem more likely to rise at or below the pace of Google's revenue increases, based on Porat's remarks to analysts Thursday.

entry.title: Google's 2Q signals new era of austerity with new CFO
entry.summary: Thursday's release of Google's report covering that period indicated that Porat already may be shaking things up.

entry.title: Google's 2nd-quarter results indicate new CFO may clamp down on spending to boost earnings
entry.summary:
Investor hopes for a more austere Google are largely tied to the arrival of a new chief financial officer, Ruth Porat.

She joined Google in late May, about two-thirds of the way through the Internet company's second quarter.

Excluding stock compensation expense and several other items, Google earned $6.99 per share - topping the average estimate of $6.70 per share among analysts surveyed by FactSet.

entry.title: Google's second quarter: What to watch
entry.summary: Analysts expect Google to earn $6.70 a share, excluding certain expenses, according to Thomson Reuters.

Grewal said it would unfairly prejudice Google to let the plaintiffs amend their lawsuit again.

The case is In re: Google Inc Privacy Policy Litigation, U.S. District Court, Northern District of California, No.
